ISSUE.TITLE: analyzedir command
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: The analyze command only analyzes one document. For some backends the startup overhead is very significant so this is inefficient. We could have an `analyzedir` CLI command that works similar to `evaldir` (and MauiTopicIndexer), i.e. it runs analyze on a directory of .txt files and writes the result into TSV files. The file extension / suffix could default to `.annif` but it should be possible to set on the command line. Something like ``` annif analyzedir [--suffix .annif] [--limit 10] [--threshold 0.00] [--verbosity INFO] <backend> <directory> ``` (also `--backend-param` should be supported)
